source.name: Final Critical Habitat buffer for the Rio Grande silvery minnow (Hybognathus amarus)
source.description: Abstract: To provide the user with a general idea of where the 91.4 m (300 ft) of critical habitat buffer for the Rio Grande silvery minnow (Hybognathus amarus) occur. The geographic extent includes Bernalillo, Sandoval, Socorro and Valencia Counties in New Mexico. Purpose: Critical habitat are areas considered essential for the conservation of a listed species. These areas provide notice to the public and land managers the importance of these areas to the conservation of this species. Special protections and/or restrictions are possible in areas where federal funding, permits, licenses, authorizations, or actions occur or are required.
